Selected Answer: A
A. CK should provision and activate CDN in those regions where traffic is high.

By provisioning and activating the Content Delivery Network (CDN) in regions where high traffic is expected, CK can ensure that content is delivered efficiently and quickly to users in those regions. CDN helps in distributing content geographically closer to users, reducing latency and improving the overall performance and user experience of the site, especially during times of high traffic.

Selected Answer: A
The record detail component can indeed only show the details of the object that the page you are building is connected to. You can therefore not show Case, Account and Opportunities (which are three different objects) details on one single page. Answer A is correct imo.

Selected Answer: A
Agree with SC22MarkTopics. recordId only passes in a single record Id, which means only one of the three record detail components could render as expected when presented all on the same page. If they were presented separately, there would be no issue.

Selected Answer: A
The Record Detail component typically displays details for a single record based on the record ID specified in the component properties. However, if you want to display details for multiple records dynamically based on the user who is logged in, you would need to use a different approach, such as custom Lightning components or Visualforce pages that query and display the required record details based on the user's context.

choices.B: The Record Detail component will only show record details for the Case object.

choices.C: The Record Detail component populates the recordID associated with the object for the page template, so this component will only work on the Home page template.
choices.A: The Record Detail component populates the recordID associated with the object for the page template, so this component will not work for this use case.
